body:
If your cursor's white, I don't think there's anything we should change about this imho.

But we should definitely render the cursor above underlines.

It might be worth noting that the position of underline/cursor depends on your font though. I'd assume most fonts do not have this problem and render the cursor below the underline.

I just noticed after updating to 0.4.2 that the issue is now less prevalent.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26434056/78031147-6c0d7800-7363-11ea-8c1a-dd782204c19b.png)

But I don't know if the fix was intended or a side-effect of some other change (just from looking at the commits). Since nobody pinged this PR.

I still think its rendered under the text decorations (underline), and only the bottom part of the cursor is seen.
We changed roundings, etc. However it wasn't fixed and just a side effect that cursor is a bit bigger in some edge cases now, so you can see it here.

issue.title: Cursor should be inverted when placed on same foreground color
issue.body:
### System
OS: Linux (but probably all)
Version: alacritty 0.5.0-dev (87e5b1aa)
Linux/BSD: X11

Here is an example in urxvt: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/301019/88189600-dae64800-cc56-11ea-888e-11faff7b68ca.png)

The same behavior in alacritty:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/301019/88189949-4c25fb00-cc57-11ea-9918-cb2aea4f404f.png)

I think usability is greatly improved with this behavior.

body: This might be fixed with https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/4373. Or at least it might make fixing this easier.

issue.title: Draw cursor with rect renderer
issue.body:
This commit makes cursors being drawn via rects, thus it's always above
underlines/strikeouts. Also, since cursor isn't a glyph anymore, it
can't be obscured due to atlas switching during glyphs drawing.

Fixes #4404.
Fixes #3471.

issue.title: text style: underline

repository.name: rio
repository.description: A hardware-accelerated GPU terminal emulator focusing to run in desktops and browsers.

issue.body: Implement underline feature in the sugarloaf. Rio and Crosswords already provide an information if the square/cell is underlined, would be similar to the way flag is working for bold, italic and bold_italic https://github.com/raphamorim/rio/blob/main/rio/src/screen/state.rs#L193-L203
